<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/17/sports-leagues-struggle-to-contain-a-spike-in-covid-cases-leading-to-scheduling-chaos?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Trying to Figure Out This Weekend’s Sports Schedule
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/17/sports-leagues-struggle-to-contain-a-spike-in-covid-cases-leading-to-scheduling-chaos?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Charlie Day meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/bbdb75deafc15edc20bb64f817c4f4fe06c7a70f-577x433.png?rect=0,11,577,404&w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Are you mildly athletic and free this weekend? Your local sports team might need you to strap on some pads. Covid cases are rippling through professional sports leagues on both sides of the Atlantic, bringing back memories of 2020 and causing major scheduling headaches for the industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the first time this season, the NFL <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/17/nfl-will-postpone-some-games-over-covid-surge-source-says.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">postponed</a> games: The Raiders-Browns game has been moved from Saturday to Monday, and the Seahawks-Rams and WFT-Eagles games have been moved from Sunday to Tuesday. (On the bright side for fans, that means eight out of the next 10 days will have NFL games.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the NFL is not the only league forced to juggle Delta, Omicron, and keeping seasons on track.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The NHL is postponing games for three teams (the Calgary Flames, Colorado Avalanche, and Florida Panthers) for the next several days.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Multiple college basketball games, including Ohio State vs. Kentucky, were </span><span><a href="https://www.cbssports.com/general/news/covid-19-postponement-tracker-multiple-college-basketball-games-canceled-amid-outbreaks/live/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled</a></span><span> this weekend.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>47 of the 63 NBA players who’ve entered Covid protocols this season have done so </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/wojespn/status/1471598716582776837?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in December</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The English Premier League has postponed five games this weekend after a spike in positive cases. The UK reported 93,045 new Covid cases on Friday, the third straight day it’s set a daily record.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Covid surge has affected sports-adjacent industries, too, like <a href="https://www.espn.com/chalk/story/_/id/32889907/nfl-point-spreads-moving-dramatically-sportsbooks-deal-covid-fallout?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gambling</a>. Sportsbooks have had to make dramatic adjustments to their game lines following reports of impactful players testing positive.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So where do we go from here?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite calls from some fans to pause seasons altogether, there is little appetite among leagues to do so given the potential financial hit. But they also don’t want to return to a circus-like situation where enough players test positive that a wide receiver has to fill in as quarterback, which is <a href="https://www.sbnation.com/nfl/2021/9/7/22660722/broncos-no-qb-game-saints-2020-covid?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what happened</a> to the Denver Broncos last season.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In a bid to prevent even more disruptions, the NFL tightened its Covid protocols this week. And the Canadian province of Ontario has reduced stadium capacity to 50% amid a surge in cases there.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>this Covid spike couldn’t have come at a worse time. Just like in many other sectors, late December is a crucial period for sports, with college football Bowl games, marquee NBA matchups on Christmas, an extra-busy Premier League slate, and the NFL playoff race all on tap.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/tiktok-trend-threatening-school-violence-debunked?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Please Don’t Duet This
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/tiktok-trend-threatening-school-violence-debunked?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Please Don’t Duet This" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e1c01b657bd54fde2f51998c93e7b8ef39ec2ab5-1024x703.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Schools around the US beefed up security, sent warning letters to parents, and even canceled classes yesterday after <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/12/17/22841431/tiktok-removes-school-violence-challenge-warnings?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unsubstantiated threats of violence</a> traveled around TikTok and other social media platforms this week. The most popular post about the potential danger wasn’t a threat, though, just a user saying they’d <em>heard</em> about threats, TikTok said. In essence, it was just a really ugly and viral game of telephone.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That didn’t stop administrators from taking extra precautions. School districts in Georgia, Minnesota, Missouri, and Texas all canceled classes Friday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Officials in New York City and New Jersey didn’t close schools, but sent emails encouraging parents to talk to their children about how serious threats of violence are.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">TikTok brings in the fact-checkers.</strong> The company that would prefer to have its name in the news for almost anything else said it will be removing “alarmist warnings” and called out local media for amplifying rumors that could “end up inspiring real world harm.”—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/crypto-nfts-metaverse-gifts-holiday-season?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
The Virtual Alternative to an Applebee’s Gift Card
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/crypto-nfts-metaverse-gifts-holiday-season?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="crypto" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9cd87b16b5e1168753be0d2f73d8d36fdab91551-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Getty Images/elenabs</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With 101 cargo ships backed up in the Pacific Ocean, more gift-givers this holiday season are skipping the physical supply chain altogether and handing their friends and family virtual goods instead. If <a href="https://www.magnifymoney.com/blog/news/investments-as-gifts-survey/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#CryptoMethodology" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surveys</a> and a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/story/how-to-give-crypto-nfts-and-digital-money-this-holiday-season-5ae7bf1b?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proliferation</a> of <a href="https://indianexpress.com/article/technology/crypto/heres-how-to-give-nft-as-a-gift-7672624/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gift</a> <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90706611/how-to-gift-crypto-bitcoin-nfts?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guides</a> are any indication, there will be a big jump in the number of NFTs and crypto investments sitting under the Christmas tree this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s what’s on 2021 wish lists:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Crypto. </strong></span><span>You can send friends and family crypto for the holidays on the platforms Coinbase or Binance, and then help them set up their account and learn how to manage their digital wallet.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">NFTs. </strong></span><span>Virtual art, avatars, and even digital clothes are all options. Adidas </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/12/16/22822143/adidas-nft-launch-into-the-metaverse-price-release-date?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a></span><span> a collection of NFTs yesterday that grant owners access to streetwear drops and “digital and physical” experiences.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">An Ethereum Name Service domain.</strong></span><span> A “.eth'' domain is the equivalent of a ”.com” address, but for the Ethereum blockchain. You can personalize the address with your recipient’s name or troll them by using their AIM screen name.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Hype around cryptocurrency, NFTs, and all-things-metaverse exploded this year, and 65% of those surveyed by Lending Tree last month said they’d like to receive an investment for the holidays—preferably crypto.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/17/key-performance-indicators-december-18?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/17/key-performance-indicators-december-18?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Toronto skyline " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e3d85f44cf583575f3ced96b7726cbccf3f05678-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Shawn Goldberg/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Canada’s corporate behemoths are more dinosaurs than unicorns. The <a href="https://thehub.ca/2021-12-16/canada-already-has-big-companiesit-needs-young-dynamic-ones-too/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">median age</a> of its fifteen largest public companies is 122 years. By comparison, the median age for US corporate titans is 45.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I may be the only investor to make money off of Theranos when all is said and done.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marc Ostrofsky lost all $150,000 of his initial investment in Theranos when the company went bust. Now, he’s trying to make some of that back by <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/16/early-theranos-investor-to-sell-stock-certificate-as-nft.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">auctioning off</a> his Series A stock certificate as an NFT. The top bid for the NFT yesterday was $7,800.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The Harvard job offer no one at Harvard ever heard of. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/16/technology/harvard-job-scam-india.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUktbfqohlSlUaBSbJUNMnqBqCgvfeh7w1nGH3NiTQSzFIiv8eCo3F-kHBZKMlZ8c2237TYu59B4IVZa44yP5DbQsqQhO0o5CAldNfeixoo9PjDyZp0s6SGO02_WavZznpcqIvnray70mNbmHqXKHPwDZ2clYe1Jhvd1us2nICwr6UUbImn4kjgopyQ8xyVjwCZyGVv_L3CxsYO92Obh_U7gheSPgOEHiI3obas-RcBV0UXVHWT3p_4XI_68ddOL4XPKX8KR0ncanukIsBVPn2sQrz6Dtg4s9iALw&smid=url-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>
</div>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><em><a href="https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-business-arts-and-entertainment-movies-tom-holland-a7d7cd52b95f79ae2ab888e1a64eb89c?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spider-Man: No Way Home</a> </em></span><span>earned an impressive $50 million at the box office in Thursday night previews, a hopeful sign for what will surely be a record-breaking opening weekend during the pandemic.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/17/jpmorgan-agrees-to-125-million-fine-for-letting-employees-use-whatsapp-to-evade-regulators.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">JPMorgan</a></span><span> was fined $200 million to settle charges that it allowed employees to send messages on personal devices to avoid oversight by regulators.</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/12/17/1065134004/levar-burton-hosting-scripps-national-spelling-bee?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Actor LeVar Burton</a></span><span>, who publicly lobbied to be the next </span><span><em>Jeopardy! </em></span><span>host, was chosen as the new host of the Scripps National Spelling Bee.</span>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAre you mildly athletic and free this weekend? Your local sports team might need you to strap on some pads. Covid cases are rippling through professional sports leagues on both sides of the Atlantic, bringing back memories of 2020 and causing major scheduling headaches for the industry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the first time this season, the NFL \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/17/nfl-will-postpone-some-games-over-covid-surge-source-says.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epostponed\u003c/a\u003e games: The Raiders-Browns game has been moved from Saturday to Monday, and the Seahawks-Rams and WFT-Eagles games have been moved from Sunday to Tuesday. (On the bright side for fans, that means eight out of the next 10 days will have NFL games.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the NFL is not the only league forced to juggle Delta, Omicron, and keeping seasons on track.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe NHL is postponing games for three teams (the Calgary Flames, Colorado Avalanche, and Florida Panthers) for the next several days.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMultiple college basketball games, including Ohio State vs. Kentucky, were \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cbssports.com/general/news/covid-19-postponement-tracker-multiple-college-basketball-games-canceled-amid-outbreaks/live/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecanceled\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this weekend.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e47 of the 63 NBA players who’ve entered Covid protocols this season have done so \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/wojespn/status/1471598716582776837?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein December\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe English Premier League has postponed five games this weekend after a spike in positive cases. The UK reported 93,045 new Covid cases on Friday, the third straight day it’s set a daily record.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Covid surge has affected sports-adjacent industries, too, like \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/chalk/story/_/id/32889907/nfl-point-spreads-moving-dramatically-sportsbooks-deal-covid-fallout?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egambling\u003c/a\u003e. Sportsbooks have had to make dramatic adjustments to their game lines following reports of impactful players testing positive.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo where do we go from here?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite calls from some fans to pause seasons altogether, there is little appetite among leagues to do so given the potential financial hit. But they also don’t want to return to a circus-like situation where enough players test positive that a wide receiver has to fill in as quarterback, which is \u003ca href=\"https://www.sbnation.com/nfl/2021/9/7/22660722/broncos-no-qb-game-saints-2020-covid?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhat happened\u003c/a\u003e to the Denver Broncos last season.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn a bid to prevent even more disruptions, the NFL tightened its Covid protocols this week. And the Canadian province of Ontario has reduced stadium capacity to 50% amid a surge in cases there.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ethis Covid spike couldn’t have come at a worse time. Just like in many other sectors, late December is a crucial period for sports, with college football Bowl games, marquee NBA matchups on Christmas, an extra-busy Premier League slate, and the NFL playoff race all on tap.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSchools around the US beefed up security, sent warning letters to parents, and even canceled classes yesterday after \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/12/17/22841431/tiktok-removes-school-violence-challenge-warnings?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunsubstantiated threats of violence\u003c/a\u003e traveled around TikTok and other social media platforms this week. The most popular post about the potential danger wasn’t a threat, though, just a user saying they’d \u003cem\u003eheard\u003c/em\u003e about threats, TikTok said. In essence, it was just a really ugly and viral game of telephone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat didn’t stop administrators from taking extra precautions. School districts in Georgia, Minnesota, Missouri, and Texas all canceled classes Friday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOfficials in New York City and New Jersey didn’t close schools, but sent emails encouraging parents to talk to their children about how serious threats of violence are.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTikTok brings in the fact-checkers.\u003c/strong\u003e The company that would prefer to have its name in the news for almost anything else said it will be removing “alarmist warnings” and called out local media for amplifying rumors that could “end up inspiring real world harm.”—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
